requirements.text: Add small, subtle hidden compliments to the girlfriend scattered throughout the application pages that are hard to see but still readable

quotes: could u add small compliments to my girlfriend accross the page make it small and hard to see but not impossible

acceptanceCriteria: Multiple small compliment texts are scattered across different pages of the application
The compliments use subtle styling (low opacity, small font size) making them hard to spot but readable when found

requirements.text: Remove the orange/golden fitness hero image from the landing page (the dramatic transformation image shown in the uploaded screenshot)

quotes: Remove the orange/golden fitness hero image

acceptanceCriteria: The orange/golden dramatic fitness transformation hero image is completely removed from the landing page
No broken image references or empty containers remain after removal
The landing page layout adjusts gracefully without the hero image

requirements.text: Fix the color theme switcher in Settings page so it actually switches colors when users select different themes

quotes: Doesent let me switch colours at all fix it please

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking on different theme options in Settings successfully changes the application's color scheme
The selected theme is applied immediately across all components
The theme selection persists after page refresh
Visual feedback indicates which theme is currently active

requirements.text: Create a separate Tasks tab in the navigation with daily fitness challenges including walk a mile, run half a mile, 20 squats, and additional varied tasks

quotes: add a seperate tab away from the others name it tasks
Daily tasks to complete such as walk a mile run half a mile 20 squats

acceptanceCriteria: A new 'Tasks' tab appears in the main navigation separate from existing tabs
The Tasks page displays daily fitness challenges with checkboxes
Default tasks include: walk a mile, run half a mile, 20 squats, and at least 3 additional varied fitness challenges
Each task can be marked as complete with a checkbox

requirements.text: Implement daily and monthly task completion tracking that stores user progress over time

quotes: track there completion at the end of the month they have a chance to have a big reward

acceptanceCriteria: The backend stores daily task completion status for each user
Task completion data is tracked and aggregated monthly
Users can view their completion history for the current month
At month's end, users with consistent completion are identified for big reward eligibility

requirements.text: Display a gym-themed 'Well Done' animation when users complete all daily tasks for the day

quotes: show animation "well done" make it a gym theme when completed

acceptanceCriteria: When all daily tasks are checked off, a celebration animation appears
The animation has a gym theme with fitness-related visual elements
The animation displays 'Well Done' as the primary message
The animation is visually distinct and rewarding

requirements.text: Show multiple-choice reward options (date night, sleepover, massage, and additional options) after completing all daily tasks for the day

quotes: make the rewards like a date night or sleepever or massage
show up a multiple choice answer with different rewards only when completed all daily tasks for that day

acceptanceCriteria: After completing all daily tasks, a multiple-choice reward selection appears
Reward options include: date night, sleepover, massage, and at least 2 additional romantic/personal rewards
The reward selection only appears when all tasks for the current day are completed
Users can select one reward option from the presented choices

requirements.text: Automatically refresh daily tasks at midnight each day with a new set of challenges

quotes: make sure they are refreshed everyday

acceptanceCriteria: Tasks reset automatically at midnight (00:00) each day
Previous day's completion status is saved before reset
New tasks are generated or rotated for the new day
Users see fresh unchecked tasks when accessing the Tasks tab after midnight

requirements.text: Add at least 3 new exercise category tabs (such as Upper Body, Lower Body, Core, Cardio) to the main navigation with curated exercise ideas for each category

quotes: add more tabs for me (different excersise ideas) u decide wich ones to add
Add at least 3 new exercise category tabs

acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 new tabs are added to the main navigation for exercise categories
Exercise categories are clearly distinct (e.g., Upper Body, Lower Body, Core, Cardio)
Each category tab displays a curated list of relevant exercise ideas
Exercise ideas include names, descriptions, and basic instructions

requirements.text: Add more customization options to the Settings page beyond theme selection

quotes: Also add more options to setting

acceptanceCriteria: Settings page includes at least 3 additional configuration options beyond theme selection
New settings are relevant to the fitness app context (e.g., units, notifications preferences, display options)
Settings changes are saved and persisted across sessions
Each setting has clear labels and intuitive controls
